description.raw:
Currently if a test doesn't run in Jenkins, the test result page lists it as `Results.test_ran` (see http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-default-devel-precise-amd64-gpu-ati/128/testReport/). This means you have to click on each test_ran to see what the test actually was.

This patch will use the test name instead of Results in the xml output of check_test_ran.py, so that it's easier to see which tests are failing to run. For example if the physics test fails to run, instead of `Results.test_ran`, it will be displayed as `physics.xml.test_ran`.

UPDATE: Instead of `Results.test_ran`, it will be displayed as `physics.test_ran`

This patch will use the test name instead of Results in the xml output of check_test_ran.py, so that it's easier to see which tests are failing to run. For example if the physics test fails to run, instead of Results.test_ran, it will be displayed as physics.xml.test_ran.
